Class LinearCombination<N extends Number>

java.lang.Object
net.tvburger.jdl.model.scalars.LinearCombination<N>
All Implemented Interfaces:
NumberTypeAgnostic<N>, EstimationFunction<N>, ScalarEstimationFunction<N>, TrainableScalarFunction<N>, TrainableFunction<N>
@Strategy(CONCRETE) public class LinearCombination<N extends Number> extends Object implements TrainableScalarFunction<N>
A simple linear scalar model of the form: 
   f(x) = bias + Î£ w_i * x_i
where the bias and weights are trainable parameters.

This class supports forward estimation of the scalar output as well as calculation of parameter gradients required for gradient-based training.

  • Constructor Details

    • LinearCombination

      public LinearCombination(N[] parameters, JavaNumberTypeSupport<N> typeSupport)
      Constructs a LinearCombination with the given parameter vector.

      The first element of the array is treated as the bias, while the subsequent elements are the weights.

      Parameters:
      parameters - parameter vector (bias + weights)

  • Method Details

    • create

      public static <N extends Number> LinearCombination<N> create(int dimensions, JavaNumberTypeSupport<N> typeSupport)
      Creates a new LinearCombination with the specified number of input dimensions.

      The underlying parameter vector will have length dimensions + 1, with the first element reserved for the bias and the rest for the weights.

      Parameters:
      dimensions - number of input features
      Returns:
      a new LinearCombination instance with zero-initialized parameters

    • getCurrentNumberType

      public JavaNumberTypeSupport<N> getCurrentNumberType()
      Specified by:
      getCurrentNumberType in interface NumberTypeAgnostic<N extends Number>

    • estimateScalar

      public N estimateScalar(N[] inputs)
      Estimates the scalar output of this linear model for the given input vector.

      The computation is: 

         output = bias + Î£ (inputs[i] * weights[i])
      Specified by:
      estimateScalar in interface ScalarEstimationFunction<N extends Number>
      Parameters:
      inputs - the input feature vector
      Returns:
      the scalar output value
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if inputs.length != arity()

    • calculateParameterGradients

      public N[] calculateParameterGradients(N[] inputs)
      Calculates the gradients of the output with respect to all parameters (bias and weights) for the given input vector.

      The gradient vector has length 1 + arity(), where:

      • Index 0 corresponds to the derivative w.r.t. the bias (always 1).
      • Indices 1..arity correspond to the input values, i.e. âf/âw_i = input[i-1].
      Specified by:
      calculateParameterGradients in interface TrainableScalarFunction<N extends Number>
      Parameters:
      inputs - the input feature vector
      Returns:
      the gradient vector (bias gradient followed by weight gradients)

    • getParameters

      public N[] getParameters()
      Returns the full parameter vector of this model. The first element is the bias, the rest are the weights.
      Specified by:
      getParameters in interface TrainableFunction<N extends Number>
      Returns:
      the parameter array

    • arity

      public int arity()
      Returns the number of input features this model accepts, equal to the number of weights (parameters.length - 1).
      Specified by:
      arity in interface EstimationFunction<N extends Number>
      Returns:
      the arity (number of input dimensions)

      public N[] getWeights()
